website_summaries.verdict: This Canada goose call produces a nice mellow tone.
pros: Flute can make several different kinds of Canada goose sounds
Easy to learn how to bring the sounds out of the call
cons: The call can take a little practice to learn how to make it sound right

customer_reviews.title: Best sounding EASY BLOWING call.
customer_reviews.text: This is the best flute goose call you can buy. I’ve tried short reed calls. And in the hands of a pro they sound way better than this call. But I just can’t seem to get them. So this call is the best for a guy like me. To Wit is all you say. You will sound way more like a goose using this than badly using a short reed call.
customer_reviews.author: John B

customer_reviews.title: Very good for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: This call sounds great. It took a little tuning but playing with the reed position up and down the tone board got a great sound after a few minutes. I originally bought a short reed but learning to blow it wasn’t worth the 2-3 times a year geese might fly over us. This call sounds good and took very little time to make decent honks. That’s all you need for starting out and the occasional goose pass by.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Its sounds great out of box
customer_reviews.text: I had an older big river goose call. It has lasted me for close to 17 years and finally is cracked so many times and has been glued so many times it lost its functionality. I bought this one and it is absolutely great perfect perfect perfect call not only for long distance calling but for short distance calling as well
customer_reviews.author: Coach Speckler

customer_reviews.title: Real easy to get the hang of
customer_reviews.text: This was my first goose call and with just a week of practice I had geese landing at my feet.
customer_reviews.author: J FB

customer_reviews.title: Practice and sound great
customer_reviews.text: Great sound. Easy use. Newbies need to practice cadence of blowing via YouTube videos of geese
customer_reviews.author: WJ Epperson

customer_reviews.title: I think this is the best goose flute out there
customer_reviews.text: I think this is the best goose flute out there. Sounds great, but be aware it takes a lot of air to make it work. I find it much easier to use the flute for simple honks and clucks, and leave the fancier sounds to a short reed call.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Hayes

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and a pretty good sound for 20 bones also doesn’t take a lot of air to get a good sound
customer_reviews.author: pierce

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like a goose.
customer_reviews.text: This is the first goose call I've used. It worked as expected with ease and called the geese right in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use....really. not like the other "easy to use" calls
customer_reviews.text: easiest call to use for honkers. I buy one for all my first season guys as it is super easy to use and sounds great. We have bagged a lot of geese because of this call.
customer_reviews.author: R. Schiele

customer_reviews.title: Pulls them in from afar!
customer_reviews.text: This call has a deep rich tone! Also very easy to use! We work geese in a very heavy agricultural area. And with this call we have no problem pulling them off other feilds around our hunting area!!
customer_reviews.author: Capt. M.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice goose call. Easy to use and draws in the geese!
customer_reviews.author: Brian D.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to blow call
customer_reviews.text: Easy to blow. With a little practice you can sound decent.
customer_reviews.author: Lon Dawg

customer_reviews.title: Good First Call
customer_reviews.text: Nice call, took me a bit to use as a first timer.
customer_reviews.author: George Massey

customer_reviews.title: Sounds cheap!
customer_reviews.text: Waste of money! Does not sound realistic at all!!! You get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Lacy

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR BEGINNERS
customer_reviews.text: Marketed for beginners. No instruction at al come with it. They will not return any contact you make.
customer_reviews.author: Delbert

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice product for the new hunter and learner. Easy to blow and sounds realistic.
customer_reviews.author: Hawk125

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Do not listen to anyone else. This is a great call. If you read the directions it tells you to pull the guts out and to flip them around. After a few days of practicing I was spot on with this call. A MUST BUY FOR GOOSE HUNTERS!!!! I've called in many geese with this and intend to call many more. I would spray the reed with rem oil because it will stick after calling a lot.
customer_reviews.author: JTD98

customer_reviews.title: Worked like expected and with a little tuning of the sound ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked like expected and with a little tuning of the sound board dialed it right in to what i wanted
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Elmore

customer_reviews.title: Quality
customer_reviews.text: good quality call after tuneing sounds like crap out the box blow hard
customer_reviews.author: Jaker

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use .
customer_reviews.text: I have about 20 calls and this is by far the easiest one to use especially to get a kid started .
customer_reviews.author: April P.

customer_reviews.title: goose call
customer_reviews.text: killed three geese with this call watch cuz it will freeze up on you so keep it warm and take them down
customer_reviews.author: George Hall

customer_reviews.title: Best goose flute
customer_reviews.text: Works great for beginners and very easy to blow. I would recommend this to all my friends.
customer_reviews.author: james bauer

customer_reviews.title: ... was a gift for my brother and he absolutely loved
customer_reviews.text: this was a gift for my brother and he absolutely loved it
customer_reviews.author: BeautyatTiffanys

customer_reviews.title: I love it and sounds
customer_reviews.text: If you want a call hard to blow this is it. I love it and sounds great
customer_reviews.author: dancerrrr

customer_reviews.title: issues
customer_reviews.text: Sounded terrible out of the box. My friend has one that sounds fine. He blew mine with no luck. Tried adjusting it with no luck. Bought a Zinks PC-1 power clucker that I like much better. I'm sure I could eventually tune this one, but I gave up.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gozzard

customer_reviews.title: excellent goose flute
customer_reviews.text: Sounds really good, nice mellow sound. It is also extremely easy to use. A great all around goose call for beginners and more advanced. I've had this call for a couple seasons now and it's still holding up really well.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Westmaas

customer_reviews.title: Highly Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Worst goose flute I've ever blown. Straight out of the package it sounded great for the first couple of blows. On about the 4th time sounded horrible. Adjusted it to sound right again. Lasted about 3 times again. I just can't keep it in tune. Don't waste your time or money on this call.
customer_reviews.author: Justin

customer_reviews.title: Goose call
customer_reviews.text: Wasn't as easy to blow as expected. Not very well satisfied at all. Camo pattern was good on the call
customer_reviews.author: james

customer_reviews.title: Bad Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Plastic packaging it came in was very damaged, has been open before, didn't work right, made a small adjustment, works decent now.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Boyle

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Bad tone! Too much effort to get a consistent sound. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew G.

customer_reviews.title: This is not a max4 goose call. It's mossy ...
customer_reviews.text: This is not a max4 goose call. It's mossy oak blades. The only reason I got this was because of the max 4. I have enough calls already
customer_reviews.author: Dan

product_meta.title: Flambeau Outdoors BR189 Big River Calls Long Honker Goose Flute, Waterfowl Call
product_meta.description: The Flambeau Outdoors Long Honker Goose Flute is the ultimate easy-to-use goose call. Specializing in hand-tuned premium calls, the Big River line features classic and contemporary designs tailored in the tradition of characteristic quality and constitution. Like the anatomy of a goose neck, the long tone channel of this call enriches the natural deep, hollow sound of a Canada's call as air pressure passes through the length of the flute. The Long Honker specializes in easily sung voluminous honks and rich single or triple clucks. Dipped in Mossy Oak Shadow Grass Blades for a natural blend over a coat because this trusted call will be kept out and on-the-ready for hailing honkers.
feature_bullets: EASY-TO-USE: The traditional Long Honker flute design is revered as the easiest blowing goose call on the market requiring the least amount of air pressure for the most realistic sounds.

IRRESISTIBLE NATURAL SOUND: The Long Honker specializes in voluminous honks and rich single or triple clucks. Like the anatomy of a goose neck, the long tone channel enriches the deep, hollow sound of a Canada goose's call.
MOSSY OAK CAMO FINISH: The Flambeau Outdoors Long Honker Goose Flute features a Mossy Oak Shadow Grass Blades camo finish for a natural blend over a camo coat.
HAND-TUNED: Every Flambeau Outdoors Big River Long Honker Goose Flute is hand-tuned for pitch perfect calling.
MADE IN THE USA: Proudly made by Flambeau Outdoors in the U.S.A. Big River Calls hail from a rich waterfowl heritage of custom Mississippi Alluvial Valley craftsmanship.
Perfectly captures the mellow tones of the Canada Goose
The easiest blowing goose call on the market
